comment.body: Good point!
@猫叉酱（小号）: Oh, that looks funny! thanks! But I didn't sign up, because of the scary warning `make sure your data is backed up before signing in`. T\_T);;;;
目前 = currently, 俺 = we, 激活的 = activated, HUB. What's the use of 俺??
And it's time for u to move on to Chinese classics and poems :)
@caryoscelus: Art of war(孫子兵法) is recommended. Easy and interesting :)
You can't teach anything if the student is not a natural born computer guy. Time-effort-evolvement effiiciency will be very low even though u teach in the best way to the non-computer guy.

@caryoscelus: Motivation is what makes him a computer guy. Not every computer guy can be a genius, but every computer guy can become an expert. Without motivation you can't make a dog do a handspring. For the man, only self-motivated effort to find out the solution of the problem gives a man a prize. non-motivated guys never reach the goal.

@caryoscelus: Inscribed in genes. Transplant your heart with the painter's one. Waking up, you will find out you became a professional painter out of nothing. If u're not born as a painter or not borrowing genes from the painter, you will give up sooner or later definitely. People don't keep going without tasting periodic fulfillment by achieving small goals one by one.
alt-F4 or ctrl-atl-F4 for tty shell login...
@caryoscelus: In case it is a server, you could schedule crontab to detect a stubborn process and kill it. In case of laptop, u'd better avoid it with care.
@ulrichard: Bingo

Current merging feature is pointless.
It's like just tearing off the site in a pointless manner and spreading them to everywhere. 
Timestamp based hubs or policy is the best: [Suggestion: Timestamp based hub system can save time and disk space in accessing ZeroNet sites.](../Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1535427494_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm)

@caryoscelus: Yes, it will solve some problems like rescuing some posts and comments from the disaster in case one of the hub creators decides to destroy his one while other hubs still survive with empty spaces here and there in the middle of conversation. But if u're the one belonged to that doomed hub, there's no way to salvage your posts anyway.
New tech is always pain in the neck..

鹿 is not 'ma(馬)', but 'lu', 'deer'.
I know 指鹿爲馬(ma), but I don't know what the phase says from the point of '不是....'
@猫叉酱: Thanks. I fully understand.

Every handheld device works well without battery while sourcing power from external AC-DC converter. 
.
Original AC power source is useless since it doesn't fix the Vcc for the logic or switching function of the devices.
what does 'hypnotic quality to stormy waters' mean?

@caryoscelus: The purpose of the battery is to provide DC power source to the device. 
If you replace the battery with the AC-DC converter, the converter also provides DC power source to the device.
Regular usb battery bank does the job what u want.

Oh, there's a man who has the same complain!
We need to add a feature which alerts the poster if he/she doesn't put more than 20 characters for description.

Substitute the experience with a kind of drugs or gambles.
It will do change u into hell permanently. lol
No need to touch the red hot kettle to know if it's hot as long as u're not an idiot. :)
舟
Are u a singer-songwriter??

It's like a weather condition. 
I tried everything but it's just OK sometimes and bad sometimes on its own pattern. (Actually no pattern at all)
.
But in case of tor-browser's embedded tor port, this phenomenon never happens. I mean, tor-browser itself works fine.
.
But if u take tor-browser's ports and feed them to zeronet.sh command line options, the unpredictable weather condition happens again.
@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: FYI, I used to suffer from such a phenomenon when I use `torsocks`, too.

I think this could be a big trouble in the near future.
Tor-browser to the clearnet almost never suffers from this kind of issue, but Zeronet does very frequently.
That's why things happen not by our desire but by the desire of the extraterritorial existences.

> it's impossible to build CPU at home

@猫叉酱（小号）: Even with 0.01$ BJTs you can build ur own CPU at home anyway. lol. 
They compiled unix OS for MCU such as PIC16xx series. lol.
We can say CPUs such as Z-80 is open source hardware anyway. More recent high end CPUs are also available as a kind of open source.

That's how Ramesses II erased Moses from Egyptian history.
This code will loop, won't it?
@If0: What if INT_MAX=0xffff and addition of 0xffff & 0x1 becomes 0x0??

Deliberate attack on Firefox. 
Google has been developing more and more Chromium browser specific javascript HTML codes that don't work on firefox browsers.
And more and more popular sites are ruining the pages on purpose if opened by firefox browsers.
Moreover, some firefox developers seem to have been received some kind of support from google. So does Libreoffice developers.
@If0: Yes, rbp-0x4 will definitely become zero with carry bit set. Then `cmp rbp-0x4, 0x0` will be equal and `jne` will be bypassed this time.
